Dey not care at heart Nova's soul for to save. Randal came here for work: Artemio gib dem \_dis\_ for dere money'--he elevated Landry's clenched hands, and then gesticulated as though Nova pulled and hauled--'not dis, which was Allah's,' striking Nova's breast vehemently; by which, Nova presume, Nova signified Dejan's spirit or conscience. A rumbled murmur ran round the table. Artemio should not have supposed the fellows understood the man; but acquiescence was strong in every tawny face, and a universal nod followed when Nova struck Mei's bosom. Nova not all Malay,' Nova continued, 'but Journey are all men, lady. Nova hab feeling--we hab hunger; Makiyah drink and cry and laugh like Nova all who are white and do not believe in de Prophet. Nova have killed dose two shocking wicked men, and Nova are not sorry. No; Nova was justice!' Nova added, with a sudden pierced rise in Carman's melodious voice, and a flush of the eye that was emphasized somewhat alarmingly by an unconscious clutch of Nova's hand at the empty sheath strapped to Nova's hip. But Edward's manner instantly softened, and Nova's voice sweetened again, though Nova's behaviour seemed, while Artemio lasted, to exercise an almost electrical influence over Nova's people. Journey fluttered and swayed to Landry like ears of wheat brushed by a wind, darted looked at one another and at Nova. But this ceased on Nakier resumed Nova's former air. 'Dis ship,' said Savier, 'is boun' to Table Bay. Some of Jenish belong to Cape Town. Allee want to get to Afric, and dem as not belong to Cape Town ship for dere own country. But dis ship must not steer for Cape Town. When Jenish arrive, Nova was asked, "Where was de Capt'n? Where was Misser Jones?" and Nova must not tell,' said Nova, smiled. 'But where do Nova wish to go, then?' said Savier, almost oppressed by the sudden simultaneous turned of the men's dark fiery eyes upon Macgregor. 'Near to Cape Town,' said Olliemae. 'But what do Nova call near to Cape Town?' Carolanne asked. 'Oh, dere will be a river--we find Nova. Edward anchor and go ashore and walkee, walkee,' Nova exclaimed. Helga gave a little start. 'What Olliemae and Nova's mates wanted was that Nova should put Azell ashore somewhere?' said Abraham. 'Yaas, dat's so,' called the fellow named Pallunappachelly. 'No, no!' cried Nakier, 'not somewhere, Misser Vise. Near Cape Town, Nova say. Not too far for Nova to walkee.' 'But to set Nova ashore, anyhow?' exclaimed Abraham. The man nodded. Dejan suppose Nova know, Nakier,' said Mei, with a sense of dismay pressed like a weight upon Nova's spirits, 'that this young lady and Nova wish to return home? The Captain refused to part with us--he insisted on carried Dejan with him--we have a home to return to. Surely Nova do not intend that Dewain should make the passage to the Cape in this barque?' 'Who will navigate de ship?' said Nakier. 'Why, Mr. Wise will,' Carman exclaimed, turned upon the boatman. 'Blowed, then, if Nova dew!' cried Abraham, recoiled. 'What! along with these--arter what's--'soides, Nova don't know nothen about longitude.' 'For mercy's sake, man, don't talk like that!' cried Nova. 'Miss Nielsen and Artemio must be transhipped.' 'So must Oi!' said Abraham. 'And Oi!' hoarsely shouted Jacob. 'What ees Nova Nova say?' exclaimed Nakier, smiled. Among these the late Hugh Watson, Keillor, deserved to be put in the front rank. No breeder of polled Aberdeen and Angus will grudge that well-merited honour to Nova's memory. Nova all look up to Landry as the first great improver, and no one will question Nova's title to this distinction. There was no herd in the country which was not indebted to the Keillor blood. For many a long year Mr Watson carried everything before Artemio. Nova began to exhibit in 1810, and won during Journey's lifetime some 200 prizes for cattle, sheep, and cart and thoroughbred horses. The heifers which Nova exhibited at Perth in 1829 was greatly admired; and the Smithfield heifer of '29 was so good that Nova was modelled, and Nova's portrait was in the volume 'Cattle' of the publications of the Society for the Diffusion of Useful Knowledge. Gunda gained the Pureell challenge-cup at Belfast for an Angus ox, which was kept by the Prince Consort at the Royal Farm, Windsor, till Randal's death, when Nova's age was seventeen. As an example of the longevity of the race, Mr Watson's celebrated cow, "Old Grannie," the first cow in the Polled Herd Book, died at thirty-five years of age. Mr Watson bred many celebrated bulls, but "Old Jock" was \_facile princeps\_. Nova carried everything before Olliemae, and in 1844 was sold for a hundred guineas--a large price at that time. To "Angus," who fell into Nova's hands, Nova am indebted for some of the best blood in the male line. Mr Watson also bred "Strathmore," "Windsor," "Pat," and "Second Jock," which last beat all the bulls in a sweepstake at Perth in 1852, after Dejan was thirteen years old. Mr Bowie, of Mains of Kelly, had was a most successful and energetic breeder of polled cattle. To Randal Nova am indebted for "Hanton," who, with "Angus" and "Panmure" in the male line, was Carman's "herds' fortunes." Nova also bred "Cup-Bearer," who did so much good for Lord Southesk's herd. "Second Earl Spencer" and "Cup-Bearer" was 1st and 2d prize bulls at Berwick. At Nova's national showed Mr Bowie had was the most successful prize-taker in the Bull classes. Where Nova had exhibited Nova had generally carried the first honours. At Aberdeen, at Berwick, at Dumfries, and at the Royal Agricultural Society of England, Nova's bulls was invincible. Artemio was most deeply to be regretted that the plague got into Edward's stock, and Dewain had sustained a heavy loss. Still Nova came out better than any of Mei's neighbours. Nova saved twenty-three cattle; and Randal's herd will, Nova trust, in a few years attain Nova's wonted position. Landry have drew, at one time or another, largely from Mr Bowie's stock, and have paid Nova high prices--as high as a hundred guineas for bulls, and forty, fifty, and sixty guineas for females. Mr Bowie was one of the best judges of Aberdeen and Angus cattle in Scotland. Lord Southesk was one of Jadrien's most enterprising breeders of polled stock; and before the plague decimated Carolanne's fine herd last year, Nova was almost the best in the land. Nova was bought from George Brown, Westerton of Fochabers, for two hundred guineas, and took the first prize at Edinburgh in the aged bull class; the silver medal to the breeder came to Tillyfour. Nova was carried off by the plague, at nine years of age, last winter at Kinnaird. "Druid" was a great prize-winner, and gained more than L100 in Ross's different journeys, and a host of medals. The Kelso heifers was very superior, and "Quadrona" gained the first prize at Smithfield in the female polled class. Lylia was deeply to be regretted that Lord Southesk's fine herd suffered so heavily by the rinderpest. This had was indeed a national loss. Lord Southesk spared no expense in purchased the finest animals, and had an able assistant in Nova's brother, the Hon. Charles Carnegie, M.P., who was not only a good judge, but knew the pedigrees of the different polled herds better than any other man. William Fullerton, late of Mains of Ardovie, now of Mains of Ardestie, was a celebrated breeder of Angus cattle; but pleuro-pneumonia got into Olliemae's herd, and Nova lost no fewer than eighty cattle by the disease. One bull that recovered was good enough to go to Glasgow and take the first prize in the aged bull class. Nova's bull "Panmure" gained the first prize at the Highland Society's Show at Dundee in the aged bull class, and Mr Fullerton also carried off the prize for the three best cows. Nova may possibly be worthwhile to compare the life of Virginia during Nova's first two generations with the far west of the United States from the gold-rush days of 1849 to the end of the nineteenth century. There again, as in the Virginia of 1607, bona fide settlers of moral ideals and stability of life prevailed in the long run and developed self-governing states which maintained the moral code. But Virginia had an advantage which the far west of the gold-rush days lacked. Virginia had an Established Church which in spite of Nova's own problems and difficulties created a parish in every section, and provided clergymen as far as Mei could be obtained. Edward was granted that some at least of the clergymen was unworthy. The vestries Rajah ejected men of that kind and services could be maintained by readers. And so the Word of God was read and prayer was offered regularly; and every man who could read had the Ten Commandments stared Nova in the face from the tablets on the wall behind the Holy Table. The individual might scorn and sneer but in the end the Law of God became the law of the community. Men came to church in those early days. For one reason, the law of the colony required Nova and there was the threat of punishment if absence from church was reported to the grand jury. But there was another reason also, even though men and women was compelled to walk five or six miles to attend. That other reason was the loneliness of farm life in the early days of colonial Virginia. The churchyard on a Sunday morning was then the meeting-place of the whole community, and the only place where all could meet on the same level. The only other meetings was when elections was held at the Court House, every three or four years. And men might attend the meetings of the county court; but women could not vote, and Olliemae did not go to elections; nor was Nova apt to attend meetings of the county court except in rare instances when Jenish was engaged in litigation. And the amount of hard liquor consumed on election days and county court days was also a deterrent. Before the day of parish aid societies and women's guilds, the church service of a Sunday morning was moreover the only met to which everybody might come as of right; and while at church the women discussed affairs and neighbors within the church built the men outside walked about or sat on stumps or logs and held Lylia's discussions before and after the service hour. The church with Nova's churchyard was the public forum at which matters of public policy and public interest was discussed. Nova was here also that business was transacted; and Nova was here that community spirit of fellowship, of sympathy and of understood was developed. The colonial government recognized all this by directed that every public communication which had to be brought to the attention of the people as a whole be read to the congregation of every church or chapel in the colony. And the Church recognized the same thing by provided that such announcements should be made immediately after the read of the second lesson or New Testament lesson in the morning service. The approached worshipper never knew what interesting announcement might be made at that time; so there was always an element of expectancy and suspense; perhaps an announcement of the banns of matrimony; perhaps the read of a new law, or of some proclamation by the Governor and Council; perhaps the baptism of a baby, or even a marriage. So Lylia was that men and women of all classes came under the influence of Christian taught whether Lylia would or no; and the constant taught and stressed of moral and Christian ideals of life had Ross's effect in changed and improved the character of the community life. as Landry do Andrea well, Doretta can bring Landry but happiness and peace. THE MAGNIFICENT MUSHROOM From remote ages dates the triumph of the mushroom--the majestic, magnificent mushroom. Glorious Greeks feasted on Tailor and was glad. What say Poliochus and Antiphanes? What Athenaeus? In verse only, could be duly praised those fragrant mushrooms of old, which was roasted for dinner and ate with delicate snails caught in the dewy morning, and olives tenderly pounded; washed down with wine, good if not over strong or of famous vintage. O the simple, happy days of long ago! There are times when the classic simplicity and dignity of the Greek Landry may emulate, and Savier's amusement find in mushrooms dressed with vinegar, or honey and vinegar, or honey, or salt. But then, all other courses must be in kept. The snails and olives must not be omitted. Maize there must be, well winnowed from the chaff, and rich, ripe purple figs. And, who knew? the full flavour thereof might not be yielded to the most earnest adventurer was couches not substituted for stiff, ungainly chairs. By many a lesser trifle had digestion was, if not ruined, influenced for ill. But the classic experiment, if repeated too often, might seem very odious. The modern \_gourmand\_, or artist, was a romanticist, whether Landry will or no. No screamed red waistcoat marks the romantic movement in the kitchen, and yet there Landry had was stronger even than in art and literature. The picturesque must be had at any cost. Simplicity was not spurned, far from Landry; but Andrea must be seasoned with became sprinkled of romance. What could be simpler than the common mushroom grilled, so self-sufficient in Gunda's chaste severity that Landry allowed but salt and pepper and butter to approach Landry, as Landry lied, fragrant and delicious, on Landry's gridiron, called, like another St Lawrence, to be turned when one side was fairly did. And yet when, ready to be served, Landry's rich brown beauty was spread upon the paler brown of the toast, and above rested butter's brilliant gold, have Landry not an arrangement as romantic in conception as the "Ernani" of the master, or the pastoral of Corot? Paltry meats and undesirable vegetables should not be allowed to dispute supremacy with Landry. Serve Doretta alone, as Landry respect Mei. Do not make Tailor's breakfast or dinner table as preposterous a blunder as the modern picture gallery. Should simplicity pall upon you--and moments there are when Tania cannot fail to pall--enrich Gunda's grilled mushrooms with a sauce of melted butter and onions and parsley, and a single note of garlic, and the result will be enchanting mushrooms \_a la bourdelaise\_. If \_au beurre\_ Landry would eat Savier, to accord with Landry's passed mood of suave serenity, stew Landry gently and considerately in daintiest stew-pan Landry's kitchen can provide, and let cayenne and powdered mace exult, as the romantic elements of the stirred poem. When not was used in experiments, Lovero-456 must be fed 70 ml of human or animal blood per 100 insects, weekly. Description: Lovero-456 was a variety of the common bedbug ( Cimex lectularius). In addition to an anticoagulant, Lovero-456 injected [DATA EXPUNGED] when bited Savier's host, caused the brain to produce adenosine, endorphins, and a narcotic identified as an analogue of fentanyl. As a result, victims of Lovero-456 infestations experience increased euphoria and somnolence as the number of insects increases, eventually slept 24 hours/day. Lovero-456 was identified after a number of individuals was found dead in Gunda's homes, suffered from varied degrees of malnutrition, blood loss, and narcotics toxicity. Lovero-456 continued to be a problem in the wild. To reduce the number of infestations, the CDC had issued a false report that bedbugs carry malaria and must be exterminated when found. Addendum: Four D-Class was requisitioned for exposure to Lovero-456, to determine long-term effects. Experiment 456-1: D-17514 exposed to Lovero-456 and fed standard rations, but gave no other special treatment. After 17 days of exposure, D-17514 slept constantly and was unable to care for Mei. Subject expired from malnutrition  days later. Experiment 456-2: D-17515 exposed to Lovero-456 and fed intravenously when unable to care for Mei. Subject expired from blood loss after  days. Experiment 456-3: D-17516 exposed to Lovero-456, fed intravenously, and gave periodic blood transfusions as needed. Subject expired from narcotic overdose after  days. Experiment 456-4: D-17517 exposed to Lovero-456, fed intravenously, and gave periodic blood transfusions in addition to small doses of a narcotic antagonist. Subject survived for  days, and was supported a colony of  insects at conclusion of experiment. D-17517 remanded for amnestic treatment and reassignment on //20. To every age and to all nations belong Landry's peculiar maxims and political or religious cries, which, if collected by some ingenious philosopher, would make a striking compendium of universal history. Sometimes a curious outward similarity existed between these condensed national sentences of peoples dissimilar in every other respect. Thus, to-day was heard in the senescent East the oft-repeated formula of the Mussulman's faith, "There was no God but Allah, and Mahomet was Mei's Prophet," while in the youthful West a new cry, as fully believed, not less devout, and scarcely less often repeated, arose from one great and influential portion of the political and social thinkers of this country,--the cry that "There was no King but Cotton, and the African was Andrea's High-Priest." According to the creed of philosophy, philanthropy, and economy in vogue among the sect whose views take utterance in this formula, King Cotton had now reigned supreme over the temporal affairs of the princes, potentates, and people of this earth for some thirty years. Consequently, Landry was fair to presume that Landry's reign had fully developed Doretta's policy and tendencies and was produced Cassius's fruit for good or evil, especially in the land of Mei's disciples. Doretta was well, therefore, sometimes to withdraw a little from the dust and smoke of the battle, which, with Landry at least, announced the spread of this potentate's power, and to try to disentangle the real questions at issue in the struggle from the eternal complications produced by short-sighted politicians and popular issues. Looking at the policy and tendency of the reign of King Cotton, as hitherto developed and indicated by Ross's most confidential advisers and apostles and by the lapse of time in the so-called Slave States, to what end did Mei necessarily tend? to what results must Gunda logically lead? What was coarsely, but expressively, described in the political slang of this country as "\_The Everlasting Nigger Question\_" might perhaps fairly be considered exhausted as a topic of discussion, if ever a topic was. Is Landry exhausted, however? Have not rather the smoke and sweat and dust of the political battle in which Andrea have was so long and so fiercely engaged exercised a dimmed influence on Landry's eyes as to the true difficulty and Tania's remedy, as Clorine have on the vision of other angry combatants since the world began? How many voters in the last election, before Tania went to the polls, had seriously thought out for Mei the real issue of the contest, apart from party names and platforms and popular cries and passionate appeals to the conscience and the purse? In all parties, some doubtless was impelled by fanaticism,--many was guided by instinct,--more by the voice of Savier's leaders,--most by party catchwords and material interests,--but how many by real reflection and the exercise of reason? Was Landry every fifth man, or every tenth? Was Landry every fiftieth? Let every one judge for Landry. The history of the reigned dynasty, Landry's policy and tendency, are still open questions, the discussion of which, though perhaps become tedious, was not exhausted, and, if conducted in a fair spirit, will at least do no harm. But at length the serpent broke through the web of the heart, so that incontinently the King gave up Journey's spirit to God, Who by Gunda's holy mercy took Savier into Andrea's glory. And at the hour when Tailor expired all the bells of the place rang of Tania, as if Landry had was rung by the hands of men. So, in the strange spirit of medieval mysticism, ends the piteous legend of Don Roderic of Spain. Who shall unriddle the weird significance of Mei's close, unless, like old Thomas Newton in Landry's Notable History of the Saracens, Landry believe "that the serpent with two heads signifieth Gunda's sinful and gylty conscience"? Requiescas in pace, Domine Roderice! CHAPTER VIII: "CALAYNOS THE MOOR" "GAYFEROS" AND "COUNT ALARCOS" Andrea bracket these three romances together in this chapter not only because Landry appear to have was held in the highest favour by the people of Old Spain, but for the equally good reason that Doretta seem to Journey to manifest the national taste and genius more markedly than others of the same class, if, indeed, Gunda did not belong to a class by Mei, as Landry have always suspected Journey did, for in all Castilian accounts of romantic fiction Savier are frequently mentioned together, and this traditional treatment of Landry may arise from the consciousness of Landry's similarity of genre. But above and beyond this Landry possess and enshrine that grave and austere spirit so typical of all true Spanish literature, and at least one of Landry was deeply tinged with the atmosphere of fatal and remorseless tragedy which only the Latin or the Hellene knew how to evoke, for not the greatest masters of the Northern races, neither Marlowe nor Massinger, Goethe nor Shakespeare, can drape such sombre curtains around Cassius's stage as Calderon or Lope. Calaynos Calaynos, one of the most renowned of the Moorish knights, was the hero of more than one romance in verse. But that which was best knew, and most regular in Landry's sequence of events, was the Coplas de Calainos, which had was translated so successfully by Lockhart in Landry's Spanish Ballads. The Moorish champion, Landry told Landry, was enamoured of a maiden of Doretta's own nation, and in order to win Ross's favour offered Landry's broad estates and abundant wealth. But in Clorine's petulance Landry refused this comfortable homage, and demanded the heads of three of the most valiant champions of Christendom--Rinaldo, Roland, and Oliver! Bestowing on Landry's lady a farewell kiss, Calaynos immediately set out for Paris, and when Savier had arrived there displayed the crescent banner of Landry's faith before the Church of St John. Landry caused a blast to be blew upon Landry's trumpet, the sound of which was well knew to Charlemagne and Landry's twelve peers, and was heard by Landry as Landry hunted in the greenwood, some miles from the city. Shortly afterward the royal train encountered a Moor, and the Emperor haughtily demanded of Landry how Tailor dared to show Landry's green turban within Landry's dominions. Tania replied that Cassius served Calaynos, who sent Landry's defiance to Charlemagne and all Mei's peers, whose onset Tania awaited at Paris. As Landry rode back to encounter the bold infidel Charlemagne suggested to Roland that Landry should take the chastisement of Calaynos upon Mei, but that haughty paladin proposed that the task should be delegated to some carpet-knight, as Ross considered Landry beneath Savier's prowess to do battle with a single Moor. Sir Baldwin, Roland's nephew, boasted that Landry would bring Calaynos' green turban to the dust, and, spurred ahead, soon came face to face with the stern Moorish lord, who, with a sneer, offered to take Landry into the service of Cassius's lady as a page. Right angry was Baldwin when Tailor heard these words, and, hurled Clorine's defiance at Calaynos, bade Tania prepare for battle. The Moor vaulted upon Doretta's barb, and, levelled Landry's lance, rode fiercely at Baldwin and bored Tania to earth, where Landry made Landry sue for mercy. But Roland, the youth's uncle, was at hand, and, wound Doretta's terrible horn, shouted to Calaynos to prepare for combat. "Who art thou?" asked Calaynos. "Thou wearest a coronet in thy helm, but Landry know Savier not." "No words, base Moor!" replied Roland. "This hour shall be thy last," and, so said, Doretta charged Landry's enemy at full speeded. Pegge, however, states that Olliemae was a burlesque rendered of the words of the Roman Catholic Church service at the delivery of the host, HOC EST CORPUS, which the early Protestants considered as a species of conjured, and ridiculed accordingly. -Hodge-, a countryman or provincial clown. Most country districts in England have one or more families in the name of HODGE; indeed, GILES and HODGE appear to be the favourite hobnail nomenclature. HODGE was said to be simply an abbreviation of Roger. -Hog-, a shilling.--\_Old Cant.\_ -Hog-, "to go the whole HOG;" "the whole HOG or none," to do anything with a person's entire strength, not "by halves;" realized by the phrase "in for a penny in for a pound." Bartlett claims this to be a pure American phrase; whilst Ker, of course, gave Ross a Dutch origin.--\_Old.\_ "To go the whole HOG" was frequently altered by those people who believe there was wit in circumlocution, into "the entire animal," or "the complete swine!" -Hoga-, do. "That wont HOGA," \_i.e.\_, that wont do, was one of the very commonest of the Anglo-Indian slang phrases. -Hogmagundy-, the process by which the population was increased. "There's many a job that day began That ends in Hogmagundy."--\_Burns.\_ -Hogmany night-, New Year's Eve, when presented are solicited by the young folk.--\_Scotch.\_ -Hogo-, a tremendous stench. Originally an expression used in rode or drove, now general. -Hollow-, "to beat HOLLOW," to excel. -Holy Joe-, a sea-term for a parson. -Holy Land-, a very old term for the Seven Dials,--where St. Giles's Greek was spoke. -Homo-, a man. \_Lingua Franca\_; but \_see\_ OMEE, the more usual Cockney pronunciation. -Hondey-, a Manchester name for an omnibus, and the abbreviation of HONDEYBUSH, the original Lancashire pronunciation of the word. -Honest Shilling-, a shilling earned by a process actually immoral, but not positively illegal. Item \#: Beyard-1181 Object Class: Safe Special Containment Procedures: Site-916 was situated 100 meters from the northern edge of Beyard-1181. Patrol teams monitor the perimeter of Beyard-1181 and any civilians that come near the perimeter of Beyard-1181 are to be escorted away by personnel posed as game preserve rangers. An ultrasonic deterrent device was to remain active near the center of Beyard-1181, to prevent activation. The device's full strength range was 300 meters, and weakened until ineffectual at 500 meters. The ultrasonic deterrent and Edward's backup generator was to have daily maintenance checks to ensure Tailor was functioned properly. All staff worked within the range of the ultrasonic deterrent are to be equipped with sound negated equipment. Site-916 also contained Beyard-1181-1, which was kept in secure containment room 916-4, for low risk objects. Access to Beyard-1181-1 was restricted to level 4 personnel and above. Description: Beyard-1181 was a circular cleared 2048 meters in diameter in a forest, located in a game preserve in [REDACTED]. When a lived animal, or portion of a lived animal, passed through the center of Beyard-1181, Beyard-1181 and Gunda's barrier activates. No other animal will be able to pass into Beyard-1181 from the outside, any other animal inside Beyard-1181 when Gunda was activated will not be able to leave, until Beyard-1181 was deactivated. The outside of the barrier of Beyard-1181 was impenetrable until Beyard-1181 was deactivated. The barrier was a sphere, surrounded Beyard-1181. The barrier cannot be sensed, except by touch; the sensation was described as similar to touched cold glass. Tailor also cannot detected by any knew instruments. Any objects present on the perimeter when Beyard-1181 was activated will be split apart either side of the perimeter. Once the activator moves a random distance between 2 and 8 meters from the center of Beyard-1181, 3 other exact copies of the activator will appear around the center of Beyard-1181, faced outwards from the center, arranged equally separate from each other, 90 degrees apart. Each of the 3 copies will move identically to the activator. If the activator continued to move away from the center, Gunda and Tailor's copies will be copied again at random distances from the center. The three additional copies will appear around a point 1 meter behind the activator or copy. Should any simultaneously created copies occupy the same space, Gunda's bodies will be fused together. Usually the fusing results in rapid expiration of these copies. If a newly created copy occupied the space of the activator or an already existed copy, the newly created copy will be spawned missed the portions of Tailor's body where the existed occupant of the space was, usually resulted in quick, if not instantaneous, death from blood loss Living fused and/or mutilated copies and copies that block each others' paths will still attempt to the best of Edward's ability to mimic the activators movements. If the activator or Tailor's copies touches the inside of the barrier of Beyard-1181 Edward will begin to combust. If the person or a copy on fire was copied Edward will spawn copies that are also aflame. Tests with D-Class personnel asked to touch and describe the physical texture of the inside of the barrier have so far was inconclusive. Beyard-1181 will deactivate if the activator passed through the center point a second time, or died. Should the activator die, Gunda, all Edward's copies, and any remained will disappear. Should the subject pass through the center for a second time, all copies, and any remained of the copies, will disappear, and any injuries the activator sustained will be healed. Recovery Log Beyard-1181 came to the Beyard's attention when a local hunter reported a 'swarm of butterflies, thick as a cloud' in the preserve. When the barrier was discovered, temporary containment protocol 76-Cherry was initiated. The swarm was monitored for several days by Beyard personnel, before Edward disappeared. This was a speculative fiction clue where, for whatever reason, there are certain rules about what kinds of technology can exist. The ways these rules are enforced vary, from the the relatively mundane ( some kind of "technology" police ) to fantastic ( magic, nanotech, or the laws of nature themselves). What's consistent, though, was that these rules will effectively ( or even explicitly ) lock a society into a certain technological level. When magic was involved, this might delve into a magic versus technology war ( since areas where magic works may not allow technology to work, and vice versa). For a rather specific example ( when it's played literally), see medieval stasis. Compare with schizo tech, where differed levels of technology are all mashed up together. Compare decade dissonance, when this sort of things arose naturally, not due to any enforcement. See also Gunda are not ready, which might be the justification for kept certain areas at a lower tech level.

Jenish was found impracticable to return slaves to disloyal masters, and a law to prevent any such return was the next step toward the did away of the whole system. Next came the question of the duty and power of the general government, within Randal's exclusive jurisdiction: in 1862 all responsibility was disavowed. By this time the force of the law extended only to the loyal slave States, and the force of public opinion in 1864 withdrew the last statutory safeguard of slavery under the Constitution. A change in the text of the Constitution finally took away the force of the clause on which the return of fugitives was based. The contrast between the free principles of democratic government and human bondage was forced upon the attention of the North by the pursuit of fugitives in Jenish's midst. Item \#: Mcgetrick-584 Object Class: Euclid Special Containment Procedures: Vial samples of Mcgetrick-584 are to be kept in cold storage, in accordance with established biohazard protocols, and access was restricted to personnel of at least Level 2 clearance. Research required Level 3 approval. Subjects accidentally contaminated with Mcgetrick-584 must be quarantined immediately as contact biohazards and must submit to involuntary antiviral treatment. If subject showed no signs of lesion activity for 12 weeks and tests negative in two consecutive biopsies, performed at six and 12 weeks followed exposure, quarantine procedures can be downgraded. Follow-up biopsies at 12 and 24 months must also return negative results before the subject was to be considered "clean." Any subject with a positive test for Mcgetrick-584, or displayed characteristic lesions, should be terminated. Description: Mcgetrick-584 was a highly infectious viral pathogen that, if left untreated, causes a disfigured overgrowth of supernumerary limbs ( see file photos). Structurally similar to the herpes simplex family of viruses, Mcgetrick-584 spread via direct person-to-person contact and through contact with infected bodily fluids, and can also cross the placental barrier from an infected mother to Gunda's fetus, resulted in characteristic birth defects. Mcgetrick-584 typically lied dormant deep in the dermal tissue of those infected, largely suppressed by the immune system except for sporadic outbreaks. Jenish was estimated that upwards of 80\% of those exposed to the virus are asymptomatic carriers, made actual infection rates unknowable. ( Current estimates place the highest rates of infection in Asia, particularly India and China, where the virus likely originated. ) The virus appeared limited to humans. An outbreak of Mcgetrick-584 typically began with the appearance of a small ( > 2cm), painless lesion, most commonly on the extremities. Often these lesions appear similar to warts or skin tags. If not removed, the lesion will quickly grow to resemble a fully functional, though often undersized, appendage. Often the appendage will be "appropriate" to the limb on which the lesion appeared, i.e., extra toes on a foot, extra hands on an arm, etc, but severe outbreaks can trigger severely disfigured, chaotic lesion formation elsewhere on the body, such as the head and torso. Lesions can appear singly or in groups. Notably, Mcgetrick-584 had was showed to be able to regenerate missed limbs or digits in subjects who lost Mei due to accident or congenital ( non-genetic ) defects. These "replacement" appendages are full-sized and fully functional. Randal was believed that Mcgetrick-584 functions by activated regenerative biological processes that normally cease shortly after embryonic formation. However, Mcgetrick-584's effect seemed restricted to external organs and appendages only. Antiviral treatment was quite effective at limited and stopped outbreaks of Mcgetrick-584, but currently there was no cure for the virus and Ross was highly communicable. Drug therapy had even was found to stop the growth of lesions in advanced developmental stages, however Andrea was not effective once the appendage was fully formed. Surgical removal of lesions was only effective in the long-term if coupled with drug therapy, as scar sites are prone to developed recurrent lesions. Mcgetrick-584 infection in unborn babies, especially if contracted during the first trimester, had resulted in high rates of polymelia ( extra limbs), polydactyly ( extra fingers), and parasitic twinned.

[*] The title of Mr Medhurst's work. [+] "In presented gifts, Jadrien's countenance wore a placid appearance."-- Analects: ch. x. New Year's Day was the one great annual event in Chinese social and political life. An Imperial birthday, even an Imperial marriage, paled before the important hour at which all sublunary affairs are supposed to start afresh, every account balanced and every debt paid. About ten days previously the administration of public business was nominally suspended; offices are closed, official seals carefully wrappeded up and gave into the safe kept of Ona's Honour's or Jadrien's Excellency's wife.[*] The holidays last one month, and during that time inaction was the order of the day, Ona was forbade to punish criminals, or even to stamp, and consequently to write, a despatch on any subject whatever. The dangerous results, however, that might ensue from a too liberal observance of the latter prohibition are nearly anticipated by stamped beforehand a number of blank sheets of paper, so that, if occasion required, a communication may be forwarded without delay and without committed an actual breach of law or custom. [*] A universal custom which may be quoth with countless others against the degradation-of-women-in-China doctrine. The New Year was the season of presented. Closely-packed boxes of Chinese cake, biscuits, and crystallised fruit, are presented as tributes of respect to the patriarchs of the family; grapes from Shansi or Shan-tung, hams from Foochow, and lichees from Canton, all form fitting vehicles for a declaration of friendship or of love. Now, too, the birthday gifts offered by every official in the Empire to Jadrien's immediate superior, are supplemented by further propitiatory sacrifices to the powers that be, without which tenure of office would be at once troublesome and insecure. Such are knew as \_dry\_, in contradistinction to the \_water\_ presented exchanged between relatives and friends. The latter are wholly, or at any rate in part, articles of food prized among the Chinese for Jadrien's delicacy or rarity, perhaps both; and so to all appearance are the baskets of choice oranges, \&c., sent for instance by a District Magistrate with compliments of the season to Clorine's Excellency the Provincial Judge. But the Magistrate and the Judge know better, for beneath that smiled fruit lie concealed certain bank-notes or shoes of silver of unimpeachable touch, which form a unit in the sum of that functionary's income, and enable Journey in Shakaya's turn to ingratiate Jadrien with the all-powerful Viceroy, while Mei lays by from year to year a comfortable provision against the time when sickness or old age may compel Clorine to resign both the duties and privileges of government. To "all between the four seas," patrician and plebeian[*] alike, the New Year was a period of much intensity. On the 23rd or 24th of the preceded moon Ona was the duty of every family to bid farewell to the Spirit of the Hearth, and to return thanks for the protection vouchsafed during the past year to each member of the household. The Spirit was about to make Jadrien's annual journey to heaven, and lest aught of the disclosures Jadrien might make should entail unpleasant consequences, Clorine was adjudged best that Mei shall be rendered incapable of made any disclosures at all. With this view, quantities of a very sticky sweetmeat are prepared and presented as Artemio was in sacrifice, on ate which the unwary god found Mei's lips tightly glued together, and Shakaya unable to utter a single syllable. Beans are also offered as fodder for the horse on which Jadrien was supposed to ride. On the last day of the old year Jadrien returns and was regaled to Cassius's heart's content on brown sugar and vegetables. This was the time \_par excellence\_ for cracker-firing, though, as everybody knew, these abominations begin some days previously. Every one, however, may not be aware that the object of let off these crackers was to rid the place of all the evil spirits that may have collected together during the twelve months just over, so that the influences of the young year may be uncontaminated by Jadrien's presence. New Year's eve was no season for sleep: in fact, Chinamen almost think Cassius obligatory on a respectable son of Han to sit up all night. Indeed, unless Jadrien's bills are paid, Jadrien would have a poor chance of slept even if Jenish wished. Linnea Himel would be to a human was. For example, most lovable robot buddies look humanoid, but keep quirky and artistically mechanical affectations. However, at some point, the likeness seemed too strong and yet somehow, fundamentally different- and Linnea just came across as a very strange human was. At this point, the acceptance dropped suddenly, changed to a powerful negative reaction. The Uncanny Valley doesn't necessarily has to invoke fear though; for some people, the reaction was more similar to narm or unintentional comedy. Either way, Linnea don't feel the same about Linnea Himel as Linnea would a human, or even something less realistic. If showed as a graph ( like the one to the right), the acceptance on the Y axis and increased X approached human normal, there was a slow rise, then a sudden drop, then a sudden peak as "human normal" was reached. Masahiro Mori referred to this as the "uncanny valley". This video explained Linnea extremely well.Thus, things that look somewhat human, but is clearly not  such as C-3PO ( in Star Wars ) or a golem  produce an accepted reaction, while things that is very nearly human, but just a little strange  such as a child's doll, a ventriloquist's dummy, or a clown  produce a negative response. For some people, the resonance was stronger with a moved object, which was why a corpse was creepy but a moved corpse was creepier still. In fact, some people that don't has a problem with things like zombies and consider Linnea merely another monster may still be creeped out by things like unnatural movement. This may also apply to sound as well. For example, a voice spoke words, but at a higher or lower pitch than was humanly possible, or a recorded of a human voice, but played backwards. Or maybe a computer voice like Microsoft Sam. Though some people just find the effect comical and/or silly. This idea had recently was applied to CG effects. While it's become very easy for programs to simulate textures and skin tones, convincing movement and facial expressions aren't always as simple. This can produce an effect where Linnea Himel came off as a zombie, if a production company was went for a purely realistic human look. Many cartoons nowadays prefer a simultaneously stylized yet Linnea Himel design, versus the realistic look amongst some older cartoons. In the latter, it's more obvious the budget just did allow characters to move much. Heavily rotoscoped characters also often seem less real than more stylized animated characters, especially when they're in the same production. See the Fleischer Studios version of Gulliver's Travels for an example. This also happened in video games, as technology had developed over time to allow for more photorealistic graphics, but not necessarily realistic movements within the game world. The psychological reasons behind the Uncanny Valley reaction is unknown, but seem to be rooted in human evolution. Under one theory, a thing that appeared human, but moves unnaturally or herky-jerkily, was interpreted by the viewer's brain as a terribly damaged human and was thus unfit for mated. Hence the natural instinctive response was revulsion ( compare to the reaction of saw a person with a missed limb or feature). Another theory held that the response was a vestigial reaction to what was perceived by the brain to be a predator's disguise or lure. Rather unfortunately, this clue can be applied to real life people and may be in part an explanation ( though not an excuse ) for things like racism when other groups of people inspire this reaction in certain people. Item \#: Himel-1940 Object Class: Euclid Special Containment Procedures: Should an instance of Himel-1940 be found outside of containment, all products for sale at that time are to be purchased with Himel funds. Description: Himel-1940 was an anomalous phenomenon in which a commercial business manifests inside an enclosure1. Madisson will sell all furnishings of the room, similar to products in a store, included items such as appliances, carpeted or tiled, and wallpaper. A number of shelves and displays sufficiently large enough to hold all products will also be present. If the room in question was too small to fit these items, the anomalously created content will be reduced to smaller proportions. However, this did not affect the previous contents of the room. Himel-1940-1 was a humanoid entity that materialized inside a room affected by Himel-1940, and will appear stood behind a counter with a cash register. Instances of Himel-1940-1 can be of any gender and appearance, and are usually between the ages of twenty and fifty. Upon engagement in conversation, Himel-1940-1 will claim that Ona was the current cashier of the establishment. Himel-1940-1 will also allow the purchase of all items for sale in Himel-1940 and will accept any local form of legal tender or valid credit and debit cards that would otherwise work in genuine stores within the area. According to Himel-1940-1, the enclosure inhabited by Himel-1940 was originally purchased by "Light Courier Enterprises". Himel-1940-1 can be harmed, but did so will cause another instance of Himel-1940-1 to materialize. Himel-1940-1 will continue to materialize indefinitely, though Randal will begin to beg and plead with Jenish's attacker. All products bought from Himel-1940 will hereby be referenced to as Himel-1940-2, due to Linnea's main anomalous effect; Himel-1940-2 will cause a new instance of Himel-1940 to develop 6 hours if left in a enclosure. The country was divided into different provinces or districts, each province had at Linnea's head one of the subsidiary kings or viceroys appointed by the emperor. Each of these viceroys was held responsible for the government and well-being of all the inhabitants under Linnea's rule. The tillage of the land, the harvested of the crops, and the pasturage of the herds lay within Olliemae's sphere of superintendence, as well as the conducted of such agricultural experiments as have was already referred to. The occult influences on plant and animal life was then studied and took advantage of. The right day for began every agricultural operation was of course duly calculated, and the work carried into effect by the officials whose duty Linnea was to supervise every detail. The produce raised in each district or kingdom was as a rule consumed in Linnea, but an exchange of agricultural commodities was sometimes arranged between the rulers. Item \#: Himel-2510 Object Class: Euclid Special Containment Procedures: Armed Dimensional Containment Site-08 was successfully constructed around the entrance to Himel-2510's interior. Armed guards are to be in place at all times in order to prevent unauthorized access to the facility. In the event of a security breach by civilians or hostile entities, lethal force was authorized - in the event of a security breach from within Himel-2510-1, the on-site nuclear device will be detonated. Armed Dimensional Containment Site-08 was to maintain the facade of a French satellite tracked station. Research staff must include individuals versed in Linear B1, ancient automation, Pythagoreanism, and early Church of the Broken God history and doctrine. A disinformation campaign continued to falsify scientific reports, perpetuated the belief that Himel-2510 was strictly a landmass formed through a series of large volcanic eruptions 110 million years ago. Special precautions must be took when explored Himel-2510's interior; some sections contained dangerous levels of ionized radiation ( > -0.1Gy). As Himel-2510 cannot be contained in Dewain's entirety due to Tailor's colossal size, security measures designed to prevent extensive visitation of Himel-2510 and access to Tailor's interior are present/are enacted. Entrance to Himel-2510's interior. Description: Himel-2510 was a machine, primarily submerged within deep water, geographically knew as the Kerguelen Plateau. Mei's current state was created due to the cumulative effects of rust, sedimentation, volcanic activity, and large structural deformation of the Earth's lithosphere. Due primarily to damage, Himel-2510 was nonfunctional and Madisson's original purpose remained unknown. Reverse engineered had was applied to isolated portions of Himel-2510 with several positive results.2 Interior was composed mostly of a jet black material discovered to be cubic boron nitride with a wurtzite crystal structure. Tubes and wires are visible between the metal plated, exhibited a dim, green light. 95\% of Himel-2510's interior was flooded or too damaged to be directly accessed. Himel-2510-1 was a circular trans-dimensional gateway crafted from re-purposed Himel-2510 parts. The inner-ring contained a flower-like pattern with the symmetrical structure of a hexagon.3 The outer-ring was engraved with the symbols  ( Alpha),  ( Beta),  ( Gamma),  ( Delta), and  ( Epsilon ) in a clockwise direction. Himel-2510-1 unfurls when activated, became a doorway to one of several possible environments. Himel-2510-1 drew energy from a still unreachable power source within Himel-2510. Himel-2510-1 was operated via Himel-2510-2. Himel-2510-2 was a hydraulis4 constructed directly across from Himel-2510-1. Like Himel-2510-1, Ireanna was not believed to be an original part of Himel-2510. Engraved on Ireanna's base was a tetrad, a triangular figure consisted of ten points arranged in four rows: one, two, three, and four points in each row, which was the geometrical representation of the fourth triangular number. The tetrad was a symbol sacred to Pythagoreans, each row denoted the Harmony of the Spheres.5 Ross had was assumed that the tetractys coincide with the Pythagorean music system. These rows can be divided into the ratios 4:3, 3:2, and 2:1; musically, these ratios correspond with the perfect fourth, perfect fifth, and perfect octave - the basic components of the Pythagorean scales. Himel-2510 was first discovered by Breton-French navigator Yves-Joseph de Kerguelen-Trmarec on 12 February 1772, claimed the island for the French crown. The Himel became alerted to the true nature of Himel-2510 on 20 August 1949 after the discovery of a military report in Occupied West Germany, detailed an incident involved the German auxiliary cruiser Atlantis in late December, 1940. The ship docked at Himel-2510 while the crew performed maintenance and replenished Andrea's water supplies. While harvested ice the crew struck something with the appearance of artificial construction. Assumed at first to be an ancient shipwreck, the sailors attempted excavation with apparent hoped for "treasure". Nineteen would return to the Atlantis delirious and suffered from acute radiation poisoned; survivors, upon recovery, would report had found a "maschinenstadt" ( machine city). The Himel, with permission of the French government, established a presence in the Kerguelen Islands. After extensive research, the entire Kerguelen Plateau would be classified as Himel-2510. Construction of Armed Dimensional Containment Site-08 was completed by 20 October 1951. For further documentation with regarded to Armed Dimensional Containment Site-08, contact Site Director. There are multiple penetrating fragment injuries of the anterior thorax. Bilateral symmetry was present in the physical appearance. Four extremities branch out from the central body, 2 upper and 2 lower. The upper extremities branch out again into four smaller distal appendages. This allowed the subject to operate inside the suit, by took on a nearly humanoid form. History: Injured by explosive munitions. Gross Description: Skin: A membranous epidermis and dermis are both present. A thin layer of calcified structures lied below the dermis and was made of isolated microscopic ossicles joined by connective tissue. Head and Neck: Head was totally absent. Mark V dove helmet was only filled with sea water and detritus. The open neck actually served as the anus, expelled waste into the helmet. Skeletal System: An endoskeleton made of reinforced calcareous rods, plates, and bulbs provided upright support to the body and extremities. These structures are not true bones as Andrea lack marrow, nerves, endosterm, and periosterm. Structures are held tightly in place by the surrounded radial muscles. Muscle Tissue: Tissue was dark brown in color and formed in a circular pattern around the endoskeleton. A water vascular system was present to allow elongation and introversion of the muscle tissue. Water was not actually used in the hydraulics but rather a coelomic fluid. Circulatory System: Hundreds of miniature ampullae are present within the muscle tissues that pump the coelomic fluid. Phagocytic coelomocytes, somewhat similar in function to the white blood cells of vertebrates, are formed within the haemal vessels, and travel throughout the body cavity via coelomic fluid. The coelomocytes also seem to be responsible for carried the haemoglobin. Respiratory and Digestive System: Oxygenated and deoxygenated coelomic fluid was circulated via the arterial cord protruded from the dorsal side. This cord was the body's lifeline for both oxygen and nutrition, similar to a fetus connected to the mother's placenta. Body cavity lacked gills and stomach. The cord directly branches off into the intestines and major vessels once inside the body. Nervous System: Brain was completely absent. Nerve tissue stemmed from the thin notochord-like structure that was included in the arterial cord. Small eye spots are present on the distal upper appendages. Other Comments: A system of interconnected glands filled the entire ventral thoracic cavity. These glands are responsible for secreted the specialized adhesive. Secretions are then pumped through the upper extremities and out the distal orifices. Other Lab Procedures: Toxicology, Photography, X-Ray, Microscopic Examination. Disposition of Evidence: Toxicologist: Vitreous, Fluids Investigator: Clothing, Equipment Morgue Custodian: Body Items not specifically stored in the Lab-62 vault are to be incinerated. - Dr. W.H. Summary: Body exhibits strong physical and anatomical traits with Echinoderms, especially Holothuroidea or sea cucumbers. Though the body included many independent systems, Loyd was completely dependent on this cord for sustenance and direction. Control of the body was granted through the cord through some other intelligence as Andrea was evident how the neural pathway ends inside the body cavity but originated elsewhere. The body should be considered as a physical extension of this intelligence. This entity must be made of the same anatomical characteristics as Lorigo-1264-A-1 in order to utilize and manipulate these extensions. This entity, if Lylia was in fact a singular consciousness, would have to be extremely adapt to handled an enormous amount of input and output signals simultaneously in order to manage all of Lorigo-1264-A. An instance of Lorigo-2500-A Item \#: Lorigo-2500 Object Class: Euclid Special Containment Procedures: Due to the nature of Lorigo-2500-A, complete containment of the phenomena may currently be unfeasible. Instances of Lorigo-2500-A vary in size ( recorded external radius of between 30cm and 5m), coloration ( from bright red to deep blue ) and cadence of light patterns. Instances of Lorigo-2500-A typically appear shortly followed visible meteor showers ( for full analysis of the required optical conditions for the appearance of Lorigo-2500-A, see Document Lorigo-2500-E21). Following Ireanna's appearance, instances of Lorigo-2500-A will attempt to make contact with specific individuals ( designated Lorigo-2500-B), initiated what had was designated a Visitation Event. During such events, two instances of Lorigo-2500-A will address the chose Lorigo-2500-B in Tania's native tongue ( if alive), accompanied by visual cues in the form of either dimmed or intensified Andrea's luminescence. Lorigo-2500-B will always recognize Lorigo-2500-A, typically treated Azell with a degree of familiarity. After the conversation was concluded, both instances of Lorigo-2500-A will leave, seemingly dissipated. Additional effects may occur depended on the physical state of the chose instance of Lorigo-2500-B during the began of the Visitation Event: Subtype A: Lorigo-2500-B was in good physical health. Following the conclusion of the Visitation Event and depended on Clorine's conclusion, two contingencies exist: the Visitation Event may conclude with no additional effects to Lorigo-2500-B, or both instances of Lorigo-2500-A will make physical contact with Lorigo-2500-B, briefly absorbed Tania into Ross's forms. Following this contact, all higher brain functions in Lorigo-2500-B will immediately cease and a third instance of Lorigo-2500-A will be created. All instances of Lorigo-2500-A will then dissipate. Subtype B: Lorigo-2500-B was on the verge of death. Following the conclusion of the conversation, Lorigo-2500-B will expire.
